src:
Koprski juriš čez Krko
04 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Uredništvo

Koprčani se gotovo ne morejo pritoževati nad razpletom 16. kroga druge slovenske nogometne lige. Svojo nalogo so proti Krki opravili brezhibno, kar pa ne velja za njihove najbližje zasledovalce na lestvici Novogoričane, ki so sklonjenih glav zapuščali igrišče v Beltincih.



Dejan Djermanović (z žogo) je začel in končal koprski strelski niz proti Krki.  Foto: Tomaž Primožič/FPA


Koper : Krka 4:0 (3:0)

Stadion Bonifika, gledalcev 400 sodnik Žnidaršič (Kranj). Strelci - 1:0 Djermanović (7), 2:0 Baša (26), 3:0 Hadžić (29), 4:0 Djermanović (74).
Koper: Nenezić, Jelić Balta (od 66. Cerovec), Vršič, Badžim, Bešir (od 59. Meštrić), Baša, Žužek, Djermanović, Pejić (od 86. Tomić), Jozinović, Hadžić. Trener: Miran Srebrnič
KOPER Nogometaši Kopra so po izpadu iz pokala rane zacelili na včerajšnji tekmi proti Krki. Novomeščani na koprski Bonifiki niso imeli nobenih možnosti. Varovanci Mirana Srebrniča, ki so v torek zaradi poškodbe za dlje časa zaradi poškodbe izgubili kapetana Ivico Guberca, so ritem igre narekovali vse srečanje. Začelo se je že v sedmi minuti, ko je predložek Dareta Vršiča z leve strani izkoristil Dejan Djermanović. Žogo je le oplazil, a dovolj, da ji je spremenil smer in je končala za hrbtom gostujočega vratarja Tonija Šuškovića. Rumeni so bili tudi v nadaljevanju srečanja podjetnejši. Veliko strelov je končalo v bloku gostujoče obrambe, ki je bila ves čas tekme pod hudim pritiskom. Vse dvome o zmagovalcu so Koprčani razrešili že v prvem polčasu. Najprej se je po napaki vratarja Krke Šuškovića, ki je žogo slabo odbijal in jo predal v noge gostiteljem, med strelce v 26. minuti vpisal hitronogi Edi Baša. Le tri minute pozneje je gol z glavo dosegel še kapetan Damir Hadžić. Drugi polčas ni prinesel nobenega presenečenja. Koprčani so še vedno prevladovali, gostje pa so se le občasno znašli pred vrati Igorja Nenezića. Piko na i visoki koprski zmagi sta v hitrem protinapadu postavila Baša in Djermanović. Prvi je ušel gostujoči obrambi, potem pa žogo potisnil do osamljenega Djermanovića, ki je zabil še drugič. ARMIN SEJARIĆ/RADIO KOPER

Beltinci : Gorica 2:1 (1:0)

Športni park, gledalcev 250 sodnik Tkalčič (Maribor). Strelci - 1:0 Knežević (40), 2:0 Raduha (76), 2:1 Grudina (89).
Gorica: Marjanović, Grudina, Kolenc (od 79. Jermol), Osuji, Volarič, Colley, M. Kavčič, T. Kavčič, Marinič (od 85. Gulič), Paljk (od 84. Hodžić), Lipušček. Trener: Borivoje Lučić.
BELTINCI Novogoričani so po remiju v Brežicah v Prekmurju doživeli še prvi gostujoči poraz v tekočem prvenstvu. V Beltincih so morda odigrali najboljši prvi polčas v dosedanjem delu sezone, žal pa obleganje domačih vrat ni prineslo želenega učinka. Mreža domačih se je po strelu Roka Grudine tudi zatresla, a je stranski sodnik zadetek razveljavil zaradi domnevno nedovoljenega položaja. Po strelu Lamina Colleyja se je tresel tudi okvir domačih vrat, da ne omenjamo niza podaj v kazenski prostor, ko so se Beltinčani reševali, kot so vedeli in znali. Kazen za neučinkovitost je sledila tik pred zaključkom prvega polčasa. Po napaki in izgubljeni žogi Žige Lipuščka je gostitelje v vodstvo popeljal Lovre Knežević, ki je sprožil prvi strel domačih proti novogoriškim vratom. V nadaljevanju se je ponovila slika iz prvega polčasa. Novogoričani so pritiskali in nizali podaje v kazenski prostor, Beltinčani pa so se reševali zlepa ali zgrda in dočakali svojo priložnost v protinapadu. Domače vodstvo je podvojil Patrik Raduha. Grudina je tik pred 90. minuto obudil novogoriško upanje, da bi v sodnikovem dodatku iztržili vsaj točko. Zaporedni koti vendarle niso obrodili sadov, naposled pa je tudi zmanjkalo časa za ogrozitev domače zmage. ASO

Vitanest Bilje : Rogaška 1:1 (0:0)

Igrišče V Dolinci, gledalcev 300 sodnik Šabanagić (Ljubljana). Strelca - 0:1 Šmigoc (87), 1:1 Humar (90).
Vitanest Bilje: Lipičar, Perko, Vencato, Žižmond, Slavec, Humar, Pušnar (od 57. Cvek), Doplihar, Slaviero, Štrukelj (od 63. Šturm), Oyewusi. Trener: Sandi Valentinčič.
BILJE S točko ni bil nihče posebej zadovoljen: ne gostje, ki so povedli v končnici tekme, ne Biljenci, ki so zlasti v drugem polčasu prevladovali. Trener Sandi Valentinčič ni skrival jeze, tako zaradi nespretnega posredovanja vratarja Jureta Lipičarja in poceni prejetega zadetka kot zaradi niza zapravljenih priložnosti, preden je Kevin Humar po prekinitvi priigral točko. Njegov čuvaj je zaman protestiral, da ga je domači strelec oviral pri skoku. Prislužil si je rumeni karton, gostje pa bi si lahko še kakšnega zaradi zavlačevanja v dobršnem delu drugega polčasa. Sicer pa razen časa niso ukradli ničesar. Preteči oblaki so se med tekmo bolj ali manj vzdržali, bolj zadržan je bil tudi prvi polčas, v katerem gostitelji niso odkrili vseh kart. Matthias Oyewusi bi sicer Biljence lahko popeljal v vodstvo, a Nigerijec včeraj ni bil strelu. Enaka ugotovitev velja tudi za njegove soigralce v drugem polčasu, ko nikakor niso mogli nameriti žoge znotraj okvirja vrat sicer zanesljivega čuvaja mreže Rogaške. Gostje so v drugem polčasu težko dohajali ritem tekmecev, a so kljub vse bolj razredčenim vrstam nekako odbili biljenske grožnje. Za povrh so iz praktično edinega strela proti domačim vratom povedli. Izenačenje je vsaj nekoliko potolažilo domače privržence, ki so se kljub muhastemu vremenu zbrali v solidnem številu. ASO

Dravograd : Brda 2:2 (0:0)

Športni center, gledalcev 200 sodnik Kovačič (Grosuplje). Strelci - 1:0 Kogelnik (65), 1:1 Marinič (74), 2:1 Kogelnik (80), 2:2 Jazbar (84).
Brda: Pintol, Rojc, Frelih, Humar (od 90. J. Bužinel), R. Bužinel (od 67. Jogan), Jazbar, Dar. Jalinous, Golob, Marinič, Curk, Daw. Jalinous (od 67. Perše). Trener: Vlado Badžim.
DRAVOGRAD Brici so po razvoju dogodkov v drugem polčasu lahko zadovoljni s točko. Vseeno pa ostaja nekaj grenkega priokusa zavoljo zamujenih priložnosti v prvem delu, v katerem so gostje imeli pobudo. Manjkal je le bolj udaren zaključek, morda tudi zaradi pomanjkanja klasičnih napadalcev. Trener Vlado Badžim ob kaznovanem branilcu Urošu Celcerju namreč ni mogel računati na Admirja Musića, nekoliko načeti Kris Jogan pa je svojo priložnost čakal na klopi. V konico napada se je tako preselil Boštjan Frelih, ki je kar dobro odpiral prostor soigralcem pri zaključevanju akcij. Pred domačimi vrati je bilo tako precej prometa. Jan Humar je dvakrat prisilil v posredovanje dravograjskega čuvaja mreže, Brici pa bi lahko tudi iz prekinitev iztržili več. Na polovici gostov je bil najbolj dejaven nekdanji reprezentant Nejc Pečnik, ki je v nadaljevanju imel prste vmes tudi pri prvem golu na tekmi. Domači protinapad, ki ga je kronal Peter Kogelnik, pa je sprožila izgubljena žoga Bricev na polovici Dravograjčanov. Gostujoča klop je nato ukrepala tudi s svežim napadalnimi močmi. Za izenačujoči zadetek je poskrbel Amadej Marinič. Podaja mladega bočnega igralca se je izkazala za neubranljiv lob, ki je presenetil domačega čuvaja mreže. Žal so morali Brici kmalu spet v rezultatski lov. Po kotu je še drugič zadel Kogelnik. Gostje pa so pokazali tekmovalni značaj in spet izid izenačili. Po podaljšanem kotu je za briško točko poskrbel kapetan Denis Jazbar, ki bo zaradi seštevka rumenih kartonov izpustil nedeljski obračun s Koprom. ASO

Drava : Jadran 0:1 (0:0)

Mestni stadion, gledalcev 100 sodnik Sagrković (Vrhnika). Strelec - 0:1 Lukanović (60)
Jadran Dekani: Cvetković, Stepančič (od 86. Živanović), Vidaković, Vranješ, Jakupovič, Zyba, Lukanović (od 80. Borghi), Babič (od 82. Perhavec), Kryeziu, Verunica, Ovsenek. Trener: Vanja Gregorović.
PTUJ Nogometaši Jadrana po menjavi na trenerski klopi nadaljujejo z odličnimi predstavami. Na zadnjih petih obračunih so kar štirikrat zmagali. V goste k ptujski Dravi, ki jo vodi nekdanji slovenski reprezentant Muamer Vugdalić, so se Dekančani odpravili precej motivirani. Gostitelji so v zadnjih krogih zapadli v krizo, ki pa so jo Pesjani le še poglobili. Dobrih sto gledalcev na ptujskem mestnem stadionu v prvem delu ni videlo zadetkov. Ekipi sta se na igrišču dobro postavili, zato pravih priložnosti ni bilo. So pa na svoj račun v drugem delu prišli navijači Jadrana, saj je edini zadetek na tekmi v 60. minuti dosegel Antonio Lukanović. Z zmago je Jadran potrdil dobro formo, ki jo je ekipa ujela po zamenjavi trenerja Erika Kržišnika z dvojcem Vanja Gregorović-Aleksandar Rodić. Očitno si želijo Pesjani še pred zaključkom jesenskega dela splezati v prvo polovico prvenstvene lestvice. ARS
text:
Koper rushing across the Krka
04 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Uredništvo

The Koper citizens certainly cannot complain about the outcome of the 16th round of the second Slovenian Football League. They did their job flawlessly against Krka, which is not the case with their closest followers on the Novogoricane scale, who, with their heads bowed, left the Beltinci playground.



Dejan Djermanovic (with the ball) started and ended the Koper shooting range against Krka. Photo: Tomaz Primozic / FPA


Koper: Krka 4: 0 (3: 0)

Bonifika Stadium, spectators 400 Referee Žnidaršič (Kranj). Goal scorers - 1: 0 Djermanovic (7), 2-0 Basa (26), 3-0 Hadzic (29), 4: 0 Djermanovic (74).
Koper: Nenezic, Balic Jelic (from 66. Cerovec), Vrsic, Badzim, Besir (from 59. Meštric), Basa, Zuzek, Djermanovic, Pejic (from 86. Tomic), Jozinovic, Hadzic. Coach: Miran Srebrnic
KOPER Koper football players were healed in yesterday's game against Krka after they lost the Cup. The residents of Bonifica's Koper had no chance. The guards of Miran Srebrnic, who lost captain Ivica Guberc on Tuesday due to an injury due to injury, dictated the rhythm of the game. It started in the seventh minute when a header from Daret Vrsic was used by Dejan Djermanovic. He only clapped the ball, but enough to change her direction and she ended up behind the back of visiting goalkeeper Toni Suskovic. The yellows were also more enterprising in the meeting. Many shots ended up in the block of the visiting defense, which was under severe pressure throughout the game. All doubts about the winner were resolved by the Koper team in the first half. First, after a mistake by goalkeeper Krka Šušković, who deflected the ball poorly and passed it to the hosts, the speedy Edi Baša scored in the 26th minute. Only three minutes later, captain Damir Hadžić scored his header. The second half came as no surprise. The Koper population was still dominant, and the guests only occasionally found themselves at the door of Igor Nenezic. The point of a high Koper victory was set in a quick counterattack by Bas and Djermanovic. The first one escaped the away defense, then pushed the ball to the isolated Djermanovic who scored the second time. ARMIN SEJARIC / RADIO KOPER

Beltinci: Gorizia 2: 1 (1: 0)

Sports Park, spectators 250 judge Tkalčič (Maribor). Goal scorers - 1: 0 Knezevic (40), 2-0 Raduha (76), 2: 1 Grudina (89).
Gorica: Marjanovic, Grudina, Kolenz (since 79th Jermol), Osuji, Volaric, Colley, M. Kavcic, T. Kavcic, Marinic (since 85th Gulic), Paljk (since 84th Hodzic), Lipušček. Coach: Borivoje Lucic.
BELTINS After the draw in Brežice in Prekmurje, the people of Nova Gorica experienced their first away defeat in the current championship. The Beltinci may have played the best first half so far, but unfortunately the siege of the home gates did not bring the desired effect. After a shot by Rok Grudina, the home team shook, but the referee canceled the goal due to an alleged unlawful position. After the shot by Lamin Colley, the frame of the home gate was also shaking, not to mention a series of passes into the penalty area as the Beltins tackled as they knew and knew. The penalty for inefficiency followed shortly before the end of the first half. After a mistake and a lost ball by Žiga Lipušček, the hosts were led by Lovre Knezevic, who launched the first shot of the home team against the goal of Novogorje. The picture from the first half was repeated. The people of Novi Sad were pushing and dropping passes into the penalty area, and the Beltinci were settling down in an evil or clumsy way, and they saw their opportunity in the counterattack. The home run was doubled by Patrick Raduha. Just before the 90th minute, Grudina raised the hope of a rookie in the hope that at least one point would be made in the referee's supplement. However, successive angles did not bear fruit, and eventually ran out of time to threaten home victory. ASO

Vitanest Bilje: Rogaska 1: 1 (0-0)

Playground In Dolinci, spectators 300 judge Šabanagić (Ljubljana). Sagittarius - 0: 1 Smigoc (87), 1-1 Humar (90).
Vitanest Herbs: Lipizzaner, Perko, Vencato, Zizmond, Slavec, Humar, Pusnar (since 57th Cvek), Doplihar, Slaviero, Štrukelj (since 63rd Sturm), Oyewusi. Coach: Sandi Valentinčič.
PLANTS No one was particularly pleased with the point: not the guests who led in the playoffs, not the Cubs, who dominated the second half especially. Coach Sandi Valentincic did not hide his anger, both due to the clumsy intervention of goalkeeper Jure Lipicar and the cheap received goal and a series of wasted opportunities before Kevin Humar scored a point after the break. His guard protested in vain that the home shooter had obstructed him from jumping. He earned a yellow card and the guests could have got another one because of the delay in the good part of the second half. Other than the time, they didn't steal anything. The passing clouds more or less abstained during the match, and the first half was more restrained, in which the hosts did not reveal all the cards. Matthias Oyewusi could have taken Biljen into the lead, but the Nigerian did not have a shot yesterday. The same observation applies to his teammates in the second half, who could not in any way find the ball inside the door frame of the otherwise reliable guard of the Rogaška net. The visitors had a hard time catching up with the rhythm of the rivals in the second half, but somehow repelled the plant threats despite the increasingly diluted species. On top of that, they were taken from practically the only shot towards the home door. The equalization at least slightly pleased the home followers who, despite the whimsical weather, gathered in solid numbers. ASO

Dravograd: Brda 2: 2 (0-0)

Sports Center, spectators 200 Judge Kovacic (Grosuplje). Goal scorers - 1: 0 Kogelnik (65), 1: 1 Marinic (74), 2: 1 Kogelnik (80), 2: 2 Jazbar (84).
Hills: Pintol, Rojc, Frehlich, Humar (from 90. J. Buzinel), R. Buzinel (from 67. Jogan), Jazbar, Dar. Jalinous, Pigeon, Marinic, Curk, Daw. Jalinous (from 67. Perseus). Coach: Vlado Badzim.
DRAVOGRAD After the development of the events in the second half, the bricks can be satisfied with the point. However, there remains some bitter taste for the missed opportunities in the first part, in which the guests had an initiative. Only a more striking finish was missing, perhaps due to the lack of classic strikers. Coach Vlado Badzim could not count on Admir Music with punished defender Uros Celcer, but Kris Jogan was somewhat startled waiting for his opportunity on the bench. Boštjan Frelih moved to the tip of the attack, opening the space for his teammates to finish the action. There was so much traffic in front of the home door. Jan Humar twice forced the intervention of the Dravograd guard of the network, and the Brici could also get more out of the interruptions. Former national team player Nejc Pečnik was the most active in the half, who continued to have his fingers in the first goal of the match. A home counterattack by Peter Kogelnik, however, was triggered by a lost Bricev ball in the Dravograd half. The visiting bench then also acted with fresh attacking power. Amadej Marinič scored the equalizing goal. The pass of the young sideline turned out to be a defenseless lob that surprised the home keeper of the net. Unfortunately, the Bricks had to go back to the result hunt soon. The corner hit Kogelnik for the second time. The guests showed a competitive character and again equalized the outcome. After a prolonged corner, the caretaker's point was taken care of by captain Denis Jazbar, who will miss Sunday's showdown with Koper due to the sum of the yellow cards. ASO

Drava: Adriatic 0: 1 (0: 0)

City Stadium, spectators 100 Judge Sagrković (Vrhnika). Sagittarius - 0: 1 Lukanovic (60)
Jadran Dekani: Cvetkovic, Stepancic (from 86. Zivanovic), Vidakovic, Vranjes, Jakupovic, Zyba, Lukanovic (from 80. Borghi), Babic (from 82. Perhavec), Kryeziu, Verunica, Ovsenek. Coach: Vanja Gregorovic.
PTUJ Adriatic football players continue their excellent performances after their change on the coaching bench. They have won four times in the last five rounds. The guests of the Ptuj Drava, led by former Slovenian national team player Muamer Vugdalić, went quite motivated. The hosts have fallen into a crisis in recent rounds, but have only been deepened by the Pesyans. A good hundred spectators at the Ptuj city stadium did not see any hits in the first part. The teams were playing well on the pitch so there was no real opportunity. In the second part, however, Adriatic fans came into their own, as Antonio Lukanović scored the only goal in the 60th minute. With the win, Jadran confirmed the good form the team has caught after replacing coach Erik Kržišnik with the Vanja Gregorovic-Aleksandar Rodic duo. Obviously, the Pesjans want to climb into the first half of the championship standings before the end of autumn. ARS
